definitions.definition: Alternative letter-case form of Universe ; Our universe.

main_definition: Alternative letter-case form of Universe ; Our universe.

definitions.definition: The sum of everything that exists in the cosmos .
examples: Do you think that the universe was created by a life force or a deity?

subdefinitions.definition: An entity similar to our universe; one component of a larger entity known as the multiverse .

examples: In all this universe of possibilities, there is only one feasible option.

subdefinitions.definition: The set of all things considered.
The set of all admissible observations .
A sample taken from the population .

definitions.definition: An imaginary collection of worlds; the general imaginary world within which a work of fiction takes place, broader than its immediate setting.

subdefinitions.definition: A collection of stories with characters and settings that typically share a continuity but are less interrelated than those of sequels or prequels .

definitions.definition: A whole world , in the sense of perspective or social setting.
examples: That didn’t just rock my world, it rocked my universe .

definitions.definition: A deity who is equivalent to the sum of everything that exists in the cosmos.
examples: The universe wants you to succeed.

definitions.definition: The Earth , the sphere of the world .

main_definition: The sum of everything that exists in the cosmos .
secondary_definitions: An imaginary collection of worlds; the general imaginary world within which a work of fiction takes place, broader than its immediate setting.
A whole world , in the sense of perspective or social setting.
( pantheism ) A deity who is equivalent to the sum of everything that exists in the cosmos.
( archaic ) The Earth , the sphere of the world .
